div.p: English music historian specializing in the music of J. S. Bach and J. C. Bach. Terry was a lecturer first at the Durham College of Science from 1890, and then at the University of Aberdeen from 1898, where he was made professor in 1903, retiring in 1930.

Terry published a biography of J. S. Bach (1929) and several studies of individual works and groups of works by Bach, and also Bach's Orchestra (1932), and produced editions of the four-part chorals and the "Coffee Cantata."
